title: JsonRpcMessage
description:
Represents any JSON-RPC message that can be sent or received.

This enum covers all possible message types in the JSON-RPC protocol:
individual requests/responses, notifications, and errors.
It serves as the top-level message container for MCP communication.

anyOf.description: A single request expecting a response
A response to a previous request

_meta.description: Optional protocol-level metadata for this content block

Annotated3.description: Represents a resource in the extension with metadata

_meta.description: Optional additional metadata for this resource

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the resource

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource content ("text" or "blob")

size.description:
The size of the raw resource content, in bytes (i.e., before base64 encoding or any tokenization), if known.

This can be used by Hosts to display file sizes and estimate context window us

uri.description: URI representing the resource location (e.g., "file:///path/to/file" or "str:///content")

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the resource template

CallToolResult.description:
The result of a tool call operation.

Contains the content returned by the tool execution and an optional
flag indicating whether the operation resulted in an error.

_meta.description: Optional protocol-level metadata for this result

content.description: The content returned by the tool (text, images, etc.)

isError.description: Whether this result represents an error condition

structuredContent.description: An optional JSON object that represents the structured result of the tool call

CancelTaskResult.description:
Response to a `tasks/cancel` request.

Per spec, `CancelTaskResult = allOf[Result, Task]` — same shape as `GetTaskResult`.

lastUpdatedAt.description: ISO-8601 timestamp for the most recent status change.

statusMessage.description: Optional human-readable status message for UI surfaces.

taskId.description: Unique task identifier generated by the receiver.

ttl.description:
Retention window in milliseconds that the receiver agreed to honor.
`None` (serialized as `null`) means unlimited retention.

ConstTitle.description:
Schema definition for enum properties.

Represent single entry for titled item

ContextInclusion.description:
Specifies how much context should be included in sampling requests.

This allows clients to control what additional context information
should be provided to the LLM when processing sampling requests.

oneOf.description: Include context from all connected MCP servers
Include no additional context
Include context only from the requesting server

CreateElicitationRequestParams.description:
Parameters for creating an elicitation request to gather user input.

This structure contains everything needed to request interactive input from a user:
- A human-readable message explaining what information is needed
- A type-safe schema defining the expected structure of the response

# Example
1. Form-based elicitation request
```rust
use rmcp::model::*;

let params = CreateElicitationRequestParams::FormElicitationParams {
   meta: None,
    message: "Please provide your email".to_string(),
    requested_schema: ElicitationSchema::builder()
        .required_email("email")
        .build()
        .unwrap(),
};
```
2. URL-based elicitation request
```rust
use rmcp::model::*;
let params = CreateElicitationRequestParams::UrlElicitationParams {
    meta: None,
    message: "Please provide your feedback at the following URL".to_string(),
    url: "https://example.com/feedback".to_string(),
    elicitation_id: "unique-id-123".to_string(),
};
```

requestedSchema.description:
Parameters for creating an elicitation request to gather user input.

This structure contains everything needed to request interactive input from a user:
- A human-readable message explaining what information is needed
- A type-safe schema defining the expected structure of the response

# Example

```rust
use mcpkit_rs::model::*;

let params = CreateElicitationRequestParams {
    meta: None,
    message: "Please provide your email".to_string(),
    requested_schema: ElicitationSchema::builder()
        .required_email("email")
        .build()
        .unwrap(),
};
```

message.description:
Human-readable message explaining what input is needed from the user.
This should be clear and provide sufficient context for the user to understand
what information they need to provide.

requestedSchema.description:
Type-safe schema defining the expected structure and validation rules for the user's response.
This enforces the MCP 2025-06-18 specification that elicitation schemas must be objects
with primitive-typed properties.

CreateElicitationResult.description:
The result returned by a client in response to an elicitation request.

Contains the user's decision (accept/decline/cancel) and optionally their input data
if they chose to accept the request.

action.description: The user's decision on how to handle the elicitation request

content.description:
The actual data provided by the user, if they accepted the request.
Must conform to the JSON schema specified in the original request.
Only present when action is Accept.

CreateMessageRequestParams.description:
Parameters for creating a message through LLM sampling.

This structure contains all the necessary information for a client to
generate an LLM response, including conversation history, model preferences,
and generation parameters.

This implements `TaskAugmentedRequestParamsMeta` as sampling requests can be
long-running and may benefit from task-based execution.

includeContext.description: How much context to include from MCP servers

maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

messages.description: The conversation history and current messages

modelPreferences.description: Preferences for model selection and behavior

systemPrompt.description: System prompt to guide the model's behavior

task.description: Task metadata for async task management (SEP-1319)

tools.description: Tools available for the model to call (SEP-1577)

CreateTaskResult.description: Wrapper returned by task-augmented requests (CreateTaskResult in SEP-1686).

CustomNotification.description:
A catch-all notification either side can use to send custom messages to its peer.

This preserves the raw `method` name and `params` payload so handlers can
deserialize them into domain-specific types.

CustomRequest.description:
A catch-all request either side can use to send custom messages to its peer.

This preserves the raw `method` name and `params` payload so handlers can
deserialize them into domain-specific types.

CustomResult.description: A catch-all response either side can use for custom requests.

ElicitationAction.description:
Represents the possible actions a user can take in response to an elicitation request.

When a server requests user input through elicitation, the user can:
- Accept: Provide the requested information and continue
- Decline: Refuse to provide the information but continue the operation
- Cancel: Stop the entire operation

oneOf.description: User accepts the request and provides the requested information
User declines to provide the information but allows the operation to continue
User cancels the entire operation

ElicitationResponseNotificationParam.description: Notification parameters for an url elicitation completion notification.

ElicitationSchema.description:
Type-safe elicitation schema for requesting structured user input.

This enforces the MCP 2025-06-18 specification that elicitation schemas
must be objects with primitive-typed properties.

# Example

```rust
use mcpkit_rs::model::*;

let schema = ElicitationSchema::builder()
    .required_email("email")
    .required_integer("age", 0, 150)
    .optional_bool("newsletter", false)
    .build();
```

description.description: Optional description of what this schema represents

EmptyObject.description:
This is commonly used for representing empty objects in MCP messages.

without returning any specific data.

EnumSchema.description:
Compliant with MCP 2025-06-18 specification for elicitation schemas.
Enums must have string type for values and can optionally include human-readable names.

# Example

```rust
use mcpkit_rs::model::*;

let enum_schema = EnumSchema::builder(vec!["US".to_string(), "UK".to_string()])
   .multiselect()
   .min_items(1u64).expect("Min items should be correct value")
   .max_items(4u64).expect("Max items should be correct value")
   .description("Country code")
   .build();
```

ErrorCode.description:
Standard JSON-RPC error codes used throughout the MCP protocol.

These codes follow the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification and provide
standardized error reporting across all MCP implementations.

ErrorData.description:
Error information for JSON-RPC error responses.

This structure follows the JSON-RPC 2.0 specification for error reporting,
providing a standardized way to communicate errors between clients and servers.

code.description: The error type that occurred (using standard JSON-RPC error codes)

data.description:
Additional information about the error. The value of this member is defined by the
sender (e.g. detailed error information, nested errors etc.).

message.description: A short description of the error. The message SHOULD be limited to a concise single sentence.

GetTaskPayloadResult.description:
Response to a `tasks/result` request.

Per spec, the result structure matches the original request type
(e.g., `CallToolResult` for `tools/call`). This is represented as
an open object. The payload is the original request's result
serialized as a JSON value.

GetTaskResult.description:
Response to a `tasks/get` request.

Per spec, `GetTaskResult = allOf[Result, Task]` — the Task fields are
flattened at the top level, not nested under a `task` key.

lastUpdatedAt.description: ISO-8601 timestamp for the most recent status change.

statusMessage.description: Optional human-readable status message for UI surfaces.

taskId.description: Unique task identifier generated by the receiver.

ttl.description:
Retention window in milliseconds that the receiver agreed to honor.
`None` (serialized as `null`) means unlimited retention.

Icon.description:
A URL pointing to an icon resource or a base64-encoded data URI.

Clients that support rendering icons MUST support at least the following MIME types:
- image/png - PNG images (safe, universal compatibility)
- image/jpeg (and image/jpg) - JPEG images (safe, universal compatibility)

Clients that support rendering icons SHOULD also support:
- image/svg+xml - SVG images (scalable but requires security precautions)
- image/webp - WebP images (modern, efficient format)

mimeType.description: Optional override if the server's MIME type is missing or generic

sizes.description: Size specification, each string should be in WxH format (e.g., `\"48x48\"`, `\"96x96\"`) or `\"any\"` for scalable formats like SVG

src.description: A standard URI pointing to an icon resource

InitializeResult.description:
The server's response to an initialization request.

Contains the server's protocol version, capabilities, and implementation
information, along with optional instructions for the client.

capabilities.description: The capabilities this server provides (tools, resources, prompts, etc.)

instructions.description: Optional human-readable instructions about using this server

protocolVersion.description: The MCP protocol version this server supports

IntegerSchema.description:
Schema definition for integer properties.

Compliant with MCP 2025-06-18 specification for elicitation schemas.
Supports only the fields allowed by the MCP spec.

LegacyEnumSchema.description: Legacy enum schema, keep for backward compatibility

LoggingLevel.description: Logging levels supported by the MCP protocol

LoggingMessageNotificationParam.description: Parameters for a logging message notification

level.description: The severity level of this log message

logger.description: Optional logger name that generated this message

ModelHint.description:
A hint suggesting a preferred model name or family.

Model hints are advisory suggestions that help clients choose appropriate
models. They can be specific model names or general families like "claude" or "gpt".

name.description: The suggested model name or family identifier

ModelPreferences.description:
Preferences for model selection and behavior in sampling requests.

This allows servers to express their preferences for which model to use
and how to balance different priorities when the client has multiple
model options available.

costPriority.description: Priority for cost optimization (0.0 to 1.0, higher = prefer cheaper models)

hints.description: Specific model names or families to prefer (e.g., "claude", "gpt")

intelligencePriority.description: Priority for intelligence/capability (0.0 to 1.0, higher = prefer more capable models)

speedPriority.description: Priority for speed/latency (0.0 to 1.0, higher = prefer faster models)

NumberSchema.description:
Schema definition for number properties (floating-point).

Compliant with MCP 2025-06-18 specification for elicitation schemas.
Supports only the fields allowed by the MCP spec.

PrimitiveSchema.description:
Primitive schema definition for elicitation properties.

According to MCP 2025-06-18 specification, elicitation schemas must have
properties of primitive types only (string, number, integer, boolean, enum).

Note: Put Enum as the first variant to avoid ambiguity during deserialization.
This is due to the fact that EnumSchema can contain StringSchema internally and serde
uses first match wins strategy when deserializing untagged enums.

message.description: An optional message describing the current progress.

progress.description: The progress thus far. This should increase every time progress is made, even if the total is unknown.

total.description: Total number of items to process (or total progress required), if known

ProgressToken.description:
A token used to track the progress of long-running operations.

Progress tokens allow clients and servers to associate progress notifications
with specific requests, enabling real-time updates on operation status.

Prompt.description: A prompt that can be used to generate text from a model

_meta.description: Optional additional metadata for this prompt

arguments.description: Optional arguments that can be passed to customize the prompt

description.description: Optional description of what the prompt does

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the prompt

PromptArgument.description: Represents a prompt argument that can be passed to customize the prompt

description.description: A description of what the argument is used for

title.description: A human-readable title for the argument

PromptMessage.description: A message in a prompt conversation

role.description: The role of the message sender

PromptMessageContent.description: Content types that can be included in prompt messages

oneOf.description: Plain text content
Image content with base64-encoded data

_meta.description: Optional protocol-level metadata for this content block

oneOf.description: Embedded server-side resource
A link to a resource that can be fetched separately

_meta.description: Optional additional metadata for this resource

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the resource

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource content ("text" or "blob")

size.description:
The size of the raw resource content, in bytes (i.e., before base64 encoding or any tokenization), if known.

This can be used by Hosts to display file sizes and estimate context window us

uri.description: URI representing the resource location (e.g., "file:///path/to/file" or "str:///content")

PromptMessageRole.description: Represents the role of a message sender in a prompt conversation

ProtocolVersion.description:
Represents the MCP protocol version used for communication.

This ensures compatibility between clients and servers by specifying
which version of the Model Context Protocol is being used.

_meta.description: Optional protocol-level metadata for this content block
Optional protocol-level metadata for this content block

RawResource.description: Represents a resource in the extension with metadata

_meta.description: Optional additional metadata for this resource

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the resource

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource content ("text" or "blob")

size.description:
The size of the raw resource content, in bytes (i.e., before base64 encoding or any tokenization), if known.

This can be used by Hosts to display file sizes and estimate context window us

uri.description: URI representing the resource location (e.g., "file:///path/to/file" or "str:///content")

_meta.description: Optional protocol-level metadata for this content block

ReadResourceResult.description: Result containing the contents of a read resource

contents.description: The actual content of the resource

Request.description:
Represents a JSON-RPC request with method, parameters, and extensions.

This is the core structure for all MCP requests, containing:
- `method`: The name of the method being called
- `params`: The parameters for the method
- `extensions`: Additional context data (similar to HTTP headers)

Request2.description:
Represents a JSON-RPC request with method, parameters, and extensions.

This is the core structure for all MCP requests, containing:
- `method`: The name of the method being called
- `params`: The parameters for the method
- `extensions`: Additional context data (similar to HTTP headers)

ResourceUpdatedNotificationParam.description: Parameters for a resource update notification

uri.description: The URI of the resource that was updated

Role.description:
Represents the role of a participant in a conversation or message exchange.

Used in sampling and chat contexts to distinguish between different
types of message senders in the conversation flow.

oneOf.description: A human user or client making a request
An AI assistant or server providing a response

SamplingMessage.description:
A message in a sampling conversation, containing a role and content.

This represents a single message in a conversation flow, used primarily
in LLM sampling requests where the conversation history is important
for generating appropriate responses.

content.description: The actual content of the message (text, image, audio, tool use, or tool result)

role.description: The role of the message sender (User or Assistant)

oneOf.description: Assistant only
User only

extensions.description:
Optional MCP extensions that the server supports (SEP-1724).
Keys are extension identifiers (e.g., `"io.modelcontextprotocol/apps"`),
values are per-extension settings objects. An empty object indicates
support with no settings.

StringFormat.description: String format types allowed by the MCP specification.

oneOf.description: Email address format
URI format
Date format (YYYY-MM-DD)
Date-time format (ISO 8601)

StringSchema.description:
Schema definition for string properties.

Compliant with MCP 2025-06-18 specification for elicitation schemas.
Supports only the fields allowed by the MCP spec:
- format limited to: "email", "uri", "date", "date-time"

Task.description:
Primary Task object that surfaces metadata during the task lifecycle.

Per spec, `lastUpdatedAt` and `ttl` are required fields.
`ttl` is nullable (`null` means unlimited retention).

lastUpdatedAt.description: ISO-8601 timestamp for the most recent status change.

statusMessage.description: Optional human-readable status message for UI surfaces.

taskId.description: Unique task identifier generated by the receiver.

ttl.description:
Retention window in milliseconds that the receiver agreed to honor.
`None` (serialized as `null`) means unlimited retention.

TaskRequestsCapability.description: Request types that support task-augmented execution.

TaskStatus.description: Canonical task lifecycle status as defined by SEP-1686.

oneOf.description: The receiver accepted the request and is currently working on it.
The receiver requires additional input before work can continue.
The underlying operation completed successfully and the result is ready.
The underlying operation failed and will not continue.
The task was cancelled and will not continue processing.

TaskSupport.description:
Per-tool task support mode as defined in the MCP specification.

This enum indicates whether a tool supports task-based invocation,
allowing clients to know how to properly call the tool.

See [Tool-Level Negotiation](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-11-25/basic/utilities/tasks#tool-level-negotiation).

oneOf.description: Clients MUST NOT invoke this tool as a task (default behavior).
Clients MAY invoke this tool as either a task or a normal call.
Clients MUST invoke this tool as a task.

TasksCapability.description: Task capabilities shared by client and server.

Tool.description: A tool that can be used by a model.

_meta.description: Optional additional metadata for this tool

description.description: A description of what the tool does

execution.description: Execution-related configuration including task support mode.

icons.description: Optional list of icons for the tool

inputSchema.description: A JSON Schema object defining the expected parameters for the tool

outputSchema.description: An optional JSON Schema object defining the structure of the tool's output

title.description: A human-readable title for the tool

ToolAnnotations.description:
Additional properties describing a Tool to clients.

NOTE: all properties in ToolAnnotations are **hints**.
They are not guaranteed to provide a faithful description of
tool behavior (including descriptive properties like `title`).

Clients should never make tool use decisions based on ToolAnnotations
received from untrusted servers.

destructiveHint.description:
If true, the tool may perform destructive updates to its environment.
If false, the tool performs only additive updates.

(This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`)

Default: true
A human-readable description of the tool's purpose.

idempotentHint.description:
If true, calling the tool repeatedly with the same arguments
will have no additional effect on the its environment.

(This property is meaningful only when `readOnlyHint == false`)

Default: false.

openWorldHint.description:
If true, this tool may interact with an "open world" of external
entities. If false, the tool's domain of interaction is closed.
For example, the world of a web search tool is open, whereas that
of a memory tool is not.

Default: true

readOnlyHint.description:
If true, the tool does not modify its environment.

Default: false

title.description: A human-readable title for the tool.

oneOf.description: Model decides whether to use tools
Model must use at least one tool
Model must not use tools

ToolExecution.description:
Execution-related configuration for a tool.

This struct contains settings that control how a tool should be executed,
including task support configuration.

taskSupport.description:
Indicates whether this tool supports task-based invocation.

When not present or set to `Forbidden`, clients MUST NOT invoke this tool as a task.
When set to `Optional`, clients MAY invoke this tool as a task or normal call.
When set to `Required`, clients MUST invoke this tool as a task.

ToolResultContent.description: Tool execution result in user message (SEP-1577).

content.description: Content blocks returned by the tool

toolUseId.description: ID of the corresponding tool use

id.description: Unique identifier for this tool call

name.description: Name of the tool to call
